title: Designing Cities and Furnitures With Machine Learning
description: Creating geometry for a computer game or a movie is a very long and arduous task. For instance, if we would like to populate a virtual city with buildings, it would cost a ton of time and money and of course, we would need quite a few artists. This piece of work solves this problem in a very elegant and convenient way: it learns the preference of the user, then creates and recommends a set of solutions that are expected to be desirable. The weapon of choice to accomplish this was Gaussian Process Regression. The paper "Interactive Design of Probability Density Functions for Shape Grammars" is available here: http://lgg.epfl.ch/publications/2015/proman/index.php The thumbnail image was created by See-ming Lee (nice name, btw!)
